user_request: Write a villanelle about the inevitability of change.
final_poem:
The river does not know it leaves the land,
but current pulls. The bed is not the same.
What started as a spring has become sand.

I watched the field go under, fence by strand,
and grass move in where nothing grew before.
The river does not know it leaves the land—

but banks erode. What bordered seems to stand
as something else entirely, nameless, worn.
What started as a spring has become sand,

now carrying silt I cannot trace or understand.
I watched the field go under, fence by strand,
and grass move in where nothing grew before.

The river does not know it leaves the land—
it only moves. The bed rewritten, charmed
by time's own script: what was is now no more.

What started as a spring has become sand,

now carrying silt I cannot trace or understand.
I watched the field go under, fence by strand,
and grass move in where nothing grew before.

rhyme_analysis.expected_scheme: ABA ABA ABA ABA ABA ABAA
